sect1.title: FreePascal-&freepascal-version;

sect2.title: Installation of FreePascal

note.para: While installation it is required to have administrator privileges. It is assumed that the current user is allowed to use sudo to gain full privileges.

Even a temporary binary compiler must be installed prior to compile the compiler from the source, it is assumed that the FreePascal sources has been extracted and the current directory has been changed to it just like as usual.

sect2.para: Begin by extracting the appropriate binary tarball for your architecture and changing to the extracted directory. This extraction is performed within the extracted source directory. Install the binary FreePascal and remove some unused files with the following commands:

screen.userinput: case "$(uname -m)" in i?86) tar -xf ../../fpc-&freepascal-bin-version;.i386-linux.tar && cd fpc-&freepascal-bin-version;.i386-linux ;; x86_64) tar -xf ../../fpc-&freepascal-bin-version;-x86_64-linux.tar && cd fpc-&freepascal-bin-version;-x86_64-linux ;; esac && rm demo.tar.gz && rm doc-pdf.tar.gz && sed -e 's;PREFIX=/usr;test -z "$PREFIX" \&\& &;' -i install.sh

sect2.para: Prepare the install directory for the temporary compiler and make it writable to the current user by executing as the root user:

screen.userinput: cd .. && case "$(uname -m)" in i?86) rm -rf fpc-&freepascal-bin-version;.i386-linux ;; x86_64) rm -rf fpc-&freepascal-bin-version;-x86_64-linux ;; esac

sect2.para: The binary version is now installed in &fpc-tmp-target; and can be used to create the compiler and utilities from source.
If building on i686 systems (32-bit), a patch is required to overcome an issue with glibc-2.34.
Compile the FreePascal compiler and tools by executing the following commands:

screen.userinput: PATH=&fpc-tmp-target;/bin:$PATH make clean && PATH=&fpc-tmp-target;/bin:$PATH make OVERRIDEVERSIONCHECK=1 all

sect2.para: Install the FreePascal compiler and tools by executing the following commands as the root user:

screen.userinput: PATH=&fpc-tmp-target;/bin:$PATH make -j1 PREFIX=/usr install && case "$(uname -m)" in i?86) ln -svf /usr/lib/fpc/&freepascal-version;/ppc386 /usr/bin/ ;; x86_64) ln -svf /usr/lib/fpc/&freepascal-version;/ppcx64 /usr/bin/ ;; esac

sect2.title: Configuring FreePascal
sect2.para: A default configuration file /etc/fpc.cfg can be created by a tool which is part of the compiler suite. Generate the default config file as the root user:

screen.userinput: /usr/lib/fpc/&freepascal-version;/samplecfg /usr/lib/fpc/&freepascal-version; /etc && cat >> /etc/fpc.cfg <<EOF #ifdef cpux86_64 # for x86_64 use -fPIC by default -Cg #endif EOF
